name: Congenital Partial Anomalous Pulmonary Venous Return (PAPVR)
chief_complaint: My child gets tired easily during play and sometimes turns blue
physical_findings: systolic ejection murmur at upper left sternal border
prognosis: Good with early surgical intervention, may have normal life expectancy with appropriate follow-up
description: A congenital heart defect where some (but not all) pulmonary veins drain into systemic veins or right atrium instead of the left atrium, creating a left-to-right shunt. This medium-complexity condition often presents with subtle symptoms in childhood.
risk_factors: family history of congenital heart disease
multiple_choice: Congenital Partial Anomalous Pulmonary Venous Return (PAPVR)
